meanings.definition: A sudden blow or thrust with the fist.
meanings.sent1: He delivered a powerful punchout to the opponent's jaw.
meanings.sent2: The boxer's punchout knocked his opponent to the ground.
meanings.sent3: The clown's punchout accidentally hit his own nose during the performance.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a verbal punchout, leaving him speechless.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the punchout echoed through the boxing ring.

meanings.definition: A device used to cut out a hole or shape in a material.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a punchout to create precise holes in the wood.
meanings.sent2: The leatherworker's punchout made perfect circles in the leather.
meanings.sent3: The chef's punchout tool made cookie-cutting a breeze in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was a punchout, shaping new ideas effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The punchout left a clean cut in the paper, ready for binding.

meanings.definition: To clock out of work using a time clock.
meanings.sent1: After finishing his shift, he had to punchout on the time clock.
meanings.sent2: Employees punchout at the end of their workday to record their hours.
meanings.sent3: The robot worker would punchout precisely at 5 p.m. every day.
meanings.sent4: She felt a sense of freedom every time she punchedout from work.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the time clock signaled the end of the day as workers punchout.
